wiki.summary: “Omertà” is the first of a two-track single released by Drake in celebration of the Toronto Raptors' victory in the 2019 NBA Finals. “Omertà” is a practice attributed to the Mafia that includes an oath to staying silent in regards to illegal activities or unlawful practices, regardless of the consequences. wiki.content: “Omertà” is the first of a two-track single released by Drake in celebration of the Toronto Raptors' victory in the 2019 NBA Finals. “Omertà” is a practice attributed to the Mafia that includes an oath to staying silent in regards to illegal activities or unlawful practices, regardless of the consequences. Drake often likens himself to the Mafia in his music, and has referenced this practice before on ”No Tellin”: "V-Live, I order that Alfredo pasta Then eat in the kitchen like I’m in the mafia." He announced the track on Instagram, following the Raptors win, along with its companion, “Money in the Grave.” During the week ending June 29, 2019, “Omertà” debuted at #35 on the Hot 100. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
